newsitem.title: GREECE: Greece to auction 3-yr bond, 7-yr FRN on Nov 22.
newsitem.headline: Greece to auction 3-yr bond, 7-yr FRN on Nov 22.

text.p: Greece will auction 100 billion drachmas of a three-year, 11-percent coupon bond and 200 billion drachmas of seven-year FRNs with the first coupon set at 13.40 percent, the finance ministry said in a statement.

Non-competitive bids for each category of bonds and FRNs can be submitted. The finance ministry retains the right to accept non-competitive bids up to 30 percent of the auctioned amount for each class of bonds.
Deputy Finance Minister Nikos Christodoulakis told reporters on Monday that Greece would issue a five-year fixed coupon bond next week but apparently changed his mind.
The statement said that interest on the bonds would be tax free implying that the government would not tax coupons on outstanding FRNs retroactively.
